channel.title: Wii
channel.description: Well, I recently lost an argument over getting a new 360 (my old one got over heated and it would basically cost the same to get a new one as to fix it) or a Wii to my girlfriend. I have played some of the Wii sport games but they just are not entertaining to me (video games are like a once a month thing for me but I still like to have at least one fun game around) so my question is, do you guys know of any good Wii games that aren't, lets say "so kidish". I mean don't get me wrong, I love Mario as much as the next kid, but I just need a few little more mature games, any suggestions?

item.title: Wii
item.dc:creator: @krackkid Krackkid
item.description:
@krackkid wrote:

My xbox(elite) never over heated, but it has burned 2 Fallout 3 disk, I think its because I played em to much. Fallout 3 was the only disk it burned though, all the others are fine.

Read full topic

item.title: Wii
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“Stupit, post:24, topic:395286”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=492472.msg3603152#msg3603152 date=1305821667]

My xbox overheated too, like, I’d turn it on, and within 10 seconds the fan would be going like a jet engine till it shut off 5 seconds later. I fixed it by re applying the thermal compound to the cpu and gpu, couldn’t you try the same? It’s not just a temporary solution like the towel fix or whatever, it costs like a tenner but it’s better than buying a whole new one.

I live in Canada and it’s never overheated and I’ve played like 15 hours straight. Maybe the weather is the factor?

Mine was 6 years old… and there was a big lack of thermal compound, plus, wouldn’t call england very hot really
[/quote]
Exactly, but it’s a bit hotter than Canada?[/quote]
I’m sure that wouldn’t make a difference, the temperature of your house would be very similar.
Have you never seen what happens to a CPU without thermal compound or a heatsink? That was the reason, not the temperature of the environment…

Read full topic

item.title: Wii
item.dc:creator: @suber_man suber man
item.description:
@suber_man wrote:

I am buying in 2 days a Wii…
Well yes, I am thinking about which game I should buy. I don’t want to waste my money to some newb game. Well I still play games at my Xbox 360 and my Xbox and my ps2 such as GTA or gun.

item.title: Wii
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

SilentCJ:

My xbox overheated too, like, I’d turn it on, and within 10 seconds the fan would be going like a jet engine till it shut off 5 seconds later. I fixed it by re applying the thermal compound to the cpu and gpu, couldn’t you try the same? It’s not just a temporary solution like the towel fix or whatever, it costs like a tenner but it’s better than buying a whole new one.

Thanks for the tip but it didn’t just do a normal overheat sadly. My drive completely busted beyond repair, and my motherboard got fried because I over looked it for so long thinking nothing would happen. Buying the spare parts for it would end up costing about the same so for now its on the back burner.

Read full topic

item.title: Wii
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

You do use a controller, the Wii controller. IIRC, you use the joystick to move around, and point the wiimote to aim and shoot. It’s really the only shooting game I can play on a console, because I can’t aim worth a crap with a joystick, only a mouse or a wiimote.

Read full topic

item.title: Wii
item.dc:creator: @Stupit Stu
item.description:
@Stupit wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Why would you aim a gun on the Wii with a joystick when you could actually aim it right at the TV like a gun? That is the main advantage of something like COD on the wii, you are actually aiming.

I think the whole point of gaming is hands on, but I’d still rather use an controller.

Read full topic

item.title: Wii
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

[quote=“Ix Soulcist xI, post:9, topic:395286”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=492472.msg3600747#msg3600747 date=1305528413]
Zelda: Twilight Princess on the Wii is one of my favorite games of all time. I spent over 60 hours beating it over a 6 day period while going to college and working (yes, I skipped a few classes), but it is really that good!

Also there are plenty of other ‘mature’ games. Call Of Duty, Metroid Prime, FarCry, and many more.
[/quote]
I’ve heard COD on the Wii was hard as Hell though, frankly I’ve never tried it myself so other than that, I don’t know.

I don’t think Mario in general is loved that much as it use to be because that use to be the main thing that adults would play at least in my family. :|[/quote]
Im going to go today and pick up a few Mario games (and for sure zelda <3 got to love the classics.)

[quote=“Stupit, post:10, topic:395286”]It could get the classic controller which makes gaming on the Wii actually quite fun.

I play some COD on the Wii some times with it.[/quote]

Are the graphics for COD worse then the 360’s on the Wii? Cause thats the main thing im scared of.

Read full topic
